text: In response to our fast-food culture, a 'slow food' movement appeared. Out of hurried parenthood, a move toward slow parenting could be growing. With vital government supports for state-of-the-art public child care and paid parental leave, maybe we would be ready to try slow love and marriage.
author: Arlie Russell Hochschild

text: Traditional marriage between a man and a woman has been a cornerstone of our society for generations. If we are going to change that, it ought to be done by the will of the people.
author: Steve Chabot

text: I don't particularly think marriage is a sane thing.
author: Sean Young

text: I'm receiving 300 to 500 letters every week from people telling me that God used my stories to save their marriage or to introduce them to Christ or to heal a relationship that had been broken.
author: Karen Kingsbury

text: Marriage, like death, is a debt we owe to nature.
author: Julia Ward Howe
